author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four-time Olympian Shiny Wilson said that Indian women call it a day once they got married or delivered of a child. “Brides and young mothers should not shy away from athletics,” the Arjuna and Padma Shri awardee said. She was speaking to the students of CMS College of Science and Commerce at the inaugural of the 28{+t}{+h}annual sports meet on Saturday.

Ms. Wilson also went down the memory lane and said how her determination and hard work helped her excel in sports and to represent the country in India and abroad even after she became a wife and a mother. She also recollected the hard work put in at a time when many other young mothers quit athletics.
title: Marriage, motherhood no excuse to shy away from sports
